approval_data.project_overview: Develop a web portal for V-KYC team leads and process managers to access and download V-KYC recordings for audit and other requirements. The portal will allow users to upload a CSV/TXT file containing LAN IDs, display results in a tabular format with pagination and search, and provide download functionality. The backend will be built using Node.js and Express, with a PostgreSQL database. The frontend will be built using React. The application will be deployed on AWS using a microservices architecture and a CI/CD pipeline.

work_items.description: Set up React project with necessary dependencies (React Router, Axios, Material-UI/Ant Design).
acceptance_criteria: Project initializes successfully.
Dependencies are installed.
Basic project structure is in place.

work_items.description: Implement user authentication and login form in React.
acceptance_criteria: Login form renders correctly.
Username and password fields are present.
Login button is functional.
Form validation is implemented (client-side).

work_items.description: Implement user registration form in React.
acceptance_criteria: Registration form renders correctly.
Username and password fields are present.
Registration button is functional.
Form validation is implemented (client-side).

work_items.description: Implement authentication service (API calls for login/register) using Axios.
acceptance_criteria: Login API call is made correctly.
Registration API call is made correctly.
Error handling for API calls is implemented.
JWT token is stored securely (e.g., in HTTP-only cookie).

work_items.description: Implement protected routes and redirect unauthorized users.
acceptance_criteria: Protected routes are accessible only to authenticated users.
Unauthorized users are redirected to the login page.
User role-based access control is implemented.

work_items.description: Create a file upload component.
acceptance_criteria: File upload component renders correctly.
User can select a file.
File type validation is implemented (CSV/TXT).
File size validation is implemented.

work_items.description: Implement API call to upload file and display results.
acceptance_criteria: File upload API call is made correctly.
Loading indicator is displayed during upload.
Results are displayed in a tabular format.
Error handling for API calls is implemented.

work_items.description: Implement table pagination.
acceptance_criteria: Pagination controls are displayed.
Records are displayed in pages of 10.
Pagination works correctly (navigates between pages).

work_items.description: Implement search functionality by LAN ID.
acceptance_criteria: Search input field is displayed.
Search results are filtered correctly based on LAN ID.
Search results update dynamically.

work_items.description: Implement download functionality for individual recordings.
acceptance_criteria: Download button is displayed for each recording.
Download API call is made correctly.
Recording is downloaded successfully.

work_items.description: Implement 'Download All' functionality.
acceptance_criteria: 'Download All' button is displayed.
Download API call is made correctly.
All selected recordings are downloaded successfully (max 10).
Loading indicator is displayed during download.

work_items.description: Implement date and month wise filtering.
acceptance_criteria: Date and month filter controls are displayed.
Results are filtered correctly based on date and month.
Filter results update dynamically.

work_items.description: Write unit tests for frontend components.
acceptance_criteria: Tests cover key functionality of components.
Tests pass successfully.
Test coverage meets the defined criteria.

work_items.description: Set up Node.js project with Express and necessary dependencies (body-parser, jsonwebtoken).
acceptance_criteria: Project initializes successfully.
Dependencies are installed.
Basic project structure is in place.
Express server starts successfully.

work_items.description: Implement user authentication endpoints (login, register) using JWT.
acceptance_criteria: Login endpoint authenticates users and returns a JWT.
Register endpoint creates new users.
Password hashing is implemented.
Error handling for authentication is implemented.

work_items.description: Implement JWT middleware for authentication.
acceptance_criteria: JWT middleware verifies tokens.
Protected routes require valid JWTs.
Unauthorized requests are rejected.

work_items.description: Implement API endpoint for file upload.
acceptance_criteria: File upload endpoint receives the file.
File type validation (CSV/TXT) is implemented.
File size validation is implemented.
File is saved temporarily (e.g., in a temp directory).
Returns a job ID for tracking.

work_items.description: Implement file processing logic (parse CSV/TXT, extract LAN IDs).
acceptance_criteria: File is parsed correctly.
LAN IDs are extracted.
Error handling for file parsing is implemented.

work_items.description: Implement API call to Recording Service to fetch recording details.
acceptance_criteria: API call to Recording Service is made correctly.
Recording details are retrieved based on LAN IDs.
Error handling for API calls is implemented.

work_items.description: Implement API endpoint to retrieve recording details (with pagination and search).
acceptance_criteria: Endpoint retrieves recording details.
Pagination is implemented.
Search by LAN ID is implemented.
Date and month filtering is implemented.
Error handling is implemented.

work_items.description: Implement API endpoint to download recordings (zip file).
acceptance_criteria: Endpoint receives a list of LAN IDs.
Recordings are retrieved from AWS S3.
Recordings are zipped.
Zip file is streamed to the client.
Error handling is implemented.

work_items.description: Implement database connection and setup (PostgreSQL).
acceptance_criteria: Database connection is established.
Database schema is defined (users, recordings).
Database migrations are implemented (if applicable).

work_items.description: Implement data access layer for user and recording data.
acceptance_criteria: User data can be saved and retrieved.
Recording metadata can be saved and retrieved.
Data access methods are implemented (CRUD operations).

work_items.description: Write unit tests for backend API endpoints.
acceptance_criteria: Tests cover key functionality of API endpoints.
Tests pass successfully.
Test coverage meets the defined criteria.

work_items.description: Implement input validation and sanitization on the backend.
acceptance_criteria: All user inputs are validated.
Invalid inputs are rejected.
Input sanitization is implemented to prevent injection attacks.

work_items.description: Implement output encoding on the backend.
acceptance_criteria: All output data is encoded.
XSS vulnerabilities are mitigated.

work_items.description: Implement rate limiting on API endpoints.
acceptance_criteria: Rate limiting is implemented on all authenticated endpoints.
Brute-force attacks are prevented.
API abuse is mitigated.

work_items.description: Create API documentation (e.g., using Swagger/OpenAPI).
acceptance_criteria: API documentation is generated.
Documentation is up-to-date.
Documentation is accessible.

work_items.description: Create database schema for users and recordings tables in PostgreSQL.
acceptance_criteria: Users table created with required fields (id, username, password_hash, role).
Recordings table created with required fields (id, lan_id, file_name, file_size, download_url, recording_date, recording_month, created_at).
Indexes are created for optimized queries (e.g., lan_id, recording_date).

work_items.description: Set up AWS infrastructure (EC2 instance, database, S3 bucket).
acceptance_criteria: EC2 instance is created and configured.
PostgreSQL database is created and accessible.
S3 bucket is created for storing recordings.
Security groups are configured to allow necessary traffic.

work_items.description: Configure CI/CD pipeline (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI) for automated deployments.
acceptance_criteria: Pipeline is configured to build and deploy the frontend.
Pipeline is configured to build and deploy the backend.
Automated testing is integrated into the pipeline.
Deployments are automated to the AWS environment.

work_items.description: Implement monitoring and logging (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack).
acceptance_criteria: Monitoring tools are set up and configured.
Application metrics are collected.
Logs are collected and aggregated.
Alerts are configured for critical events.

work_items.description: Deploy the application to the AWS environment.
acceptance_criteria: Frontend is deployed.
Backend is deployed.
Database is accessible.
Application is accessible via a public URL.

work_items.description: Configure monitoring and alerting.
acceptance_criteria: Monitoring dashboards are configured.
Alerts are configured for critical events.
Alerts are tested and working.

work_items.description: Perform integration tests for frontend and backend.
acceptance_criteria: Tests verify the interaction between frontend and backend.
Tests cover key user flows.
Tests pass successfully.

work_items.description: Perform user acceptance testing (UAT).
acceptance_criteria: Authorized users test the application.
Feedback is collected.
Issues are documented and addressed.

The portal will allow users to upload a CSV/TXT file containing LAN IDs, display results in a tabular format with pagination and search, and provide download functionality. The backend will be built using Node.js and Express, with a PostgreSQL database. The frontend will be built using React. The application will be deployed on AWS using a microservices architecture and a CI/CD pipeline.')

requirements_analysis.project_name: V-KYC recordings to be fetched for Audit requirements
requirements_analysis.project_summary: Develop a portal/dashboard for V-KYC team leads and process managers to access and download V-KYC recordings for audit and other requirements.
project_goals: Provide easy access to V-KYC recordings for audit and internal requirements.
Reduce dependency on IT data server team for retrieving recordings.
Improve efficiency in accessing and downloading recordings.
requirements_analysis.business_context: The V-KYC team currently relies on the IT data server team to provide recordings, which are stored on the LTF AWS server. This process is manual and time-consuming. This project aims to streamline the process by providing a self-service portal.

requirements.description: The system shall allow users to upload a CSV/TXT file containing up to 50 LAN IDs.
The system shall trigger a backend API call to process the uploaded file.
The system shall display the results in a tabular format with a 'Download All' option.
The table shall have pagination to display 10 records at a time.
The system shall allow downloading a maximum of 10 records at a time.
The recordings shall be available date and month wise.
The recordings shall be searchable by LAN ID.
Access to the portal shall be restricted to Team Leads and Process Managers.

functional_requirements: Upload CSV/TXT file with LAN IDs (max 50).
Trigger backend API call to process the file.
Display results in a tabular format.
Implement table pagination (10 records per page).
Allow downloading a maximum of 10 records at a time.
Display recordings date and month wise.
Provide option for bulk video download.
non_functional_requirements: Access to the portal should be restricted to authorized users (Team Leads and Process Managers).
success_criteria: V-KYC recordings are easily accessible to authorized users.
Reduced dependency on the IT data server team.
Improved efficiency in retrieving and downloading recordings.
constraints: File upload limit of 50 LAN IDs.
Maximum 10 records download at a time.
assumptions: The backend API for processing the file upload is available.
The LTF AWS server is accessible and recordings are stored correctly.
The necessary infrastructure for the portal is available.
risks: Issues with accessing the LTF AWS server.
Performance issues with large data sets.

recommendations: Specify the backend API details (e.g., API endpoints, data formats).
Define the security measures for the portal.
Detail the error handling and logging mechanisms.

identified_gaps: Security requirements are not fully defined.
Error handling and logging are not specified.
recommendations_for_completion: Define security requirements (authentication, authorization, data encryption).
Specify error handling and logging procedures.

frontend_options.name: React
frontend_options.reasoning: React offers a component-based architecture, making it ideal for building interactive UIs. Its virtual DOM and efficient update mechanisms contribute to good performance.  It has a large community and extensive library support.
pros: Component-based architecture for reusability and maintainability.
cons: Requires understanding of JSX.
Can have a steeper learning curve for beginners.
Requires additional libraries for routing and state management.

frontend_options.name: Angular
frontend_options.reasoning: Angular provides a comprehensive framework with built-in features like routing, state management, and dependency injection. TypeScript offers strong typing, improving code quality and maintainability, especially for larger projects.
cons: Steeper learning curve compared to React.
Can be verbose.
Larger bundle sizes.

frontend_options.name: Vue.js
frontend_options.reasoning: Vue.js is a progressive framework that's easy to learn and integrate into existing projects. It offers a flexible and performant solution for building user interfaces. It's known for its simplicity and excellent documentation.
cons: Smaller community compared to React and Angular.
Ecosystem is not as mature as React or Angular.

backend_options.name: Node.js with Express
backend_options.reasoning: Node.js with Express provides a lightweight, scalable, and efficient backend solution. JavaScript allows for full-stack development with a single language. Express simplifies API creation and routing.
key_libraries: Axios (for making API calls to AWS S3)
cons: Callback hell can be an issue (can be mitigated with async/await).
Requires careful error handling.
Performance can be a concern for CPU-intensive tasks.

backend_options.name: Python with Django/Flask
backend_options.reasoning: Python offers a clean and readable syntax. Django provides a full-featured framework for rapid development, while Flask offers more flexibility and control. Both have excellent libraries for various tasks.
pros: Django provides a rapid development experience.
cons: Can be slower than Node.js for some tasks.
Django can be overly opinionated.
Requires understanding of Python.

backend_options.name: Java with Spring Boot
backend_options.reasoning: Java is a robust and mature language. Spring Boot simplifies Java development and provides a production-ready framework. It offers excellent scalability and performance.
cons: Steeper learning curve.
Can be verbose.
Requires more resources than other options.

database_options.name: PostgreSQL
database_options.reasoning: PostgreSQL is a robust, open-source relational database with excellent support for data integrity, scalability, and complex queries. It's a good choice for this project due to its reliability and ability to handle structured data.
cons: Can be more complex to set up and manage than simpler databases.
Requires more resources than simpler databases.

database_options.name: MySQL
database_options.reasoning: MySQL is a widely used relational database known for its ease of use and performance. It's a good option if simplicity and speed of development are priorities.
pros: Easy to use and set up.
cons: Less feature-rich than PostgreSQL.
Can have limitations with complex queries.

database_options.name: MongoDB
database_options.reasoning: MongoDB is a NoSQL database that offers flexibility and scalability. It's suitable if the data structure is not strictly defined or if the application requires high write throughput. However, it might not be the best choice for complex relationships.
cons: Can be less performant for complex queries.
Not ideal for applications with strict relational data requirements.
Data consistency can be more challenging to manage.

cloud_options.name: AWS
cloud_options.reasoning: AWS provides a comprehensive suite of services for building and deploying applications. It offers scalability, reliability, and a wide range of options for compute, storage, and databases. The existing infrastructure on LTF AWS server makes it a natural fit.
key_libraries: AWS SDK (for interacting with AWS services)
cons: Can be complex to manage.
Cost can be a concern if not managed properly.
Steeper learning curve.

cloud_options.name: Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
cloud_options.reasoning: GCP offers a strong set of services with a focus on data analytics and machine learning. It's a good alternative to AWS, with competitive pricing and a user-friendly interface.
pros: Strong in data analytics and machine learning.
cons: Smaller market share than AWS.
Ecosystem is not as mature as AWS.
Can be complex to manage.

cloud_options.name: Microsoft Azure
cloud_options.reasoning: Azure is a good choice if the organization already uses Microsoft products. It integrates well with other Microsoft services and offers a wide range of services.
cons: Can be complex to manage.
Ecosystem is not as mature as AWS.
Can be more expensive than AWS or GCP.

architecture_options.reasoning: Microservices architecture allows for independent scaling of different components, improving scalability. It also enhances maintainability by isolating concerns. Development speed can be slower initially due to the distributed nature, but it improves over time. This is a good fit for future growth and independent scaling of the portal's components.

Monolithic architecture is faster to develop initially. However, it can become harder to scale and maintain as the application grows. This is a viable option if the project is expected to remain relatively small and the focus is on rapid development.

Serverless architecture offers excellent scalability and reduces operational overhead. It can improve maintainability by focusing on individual functions. Development speed can be fast, but debugging can be more challenging. This is a good option if the backend API can be broken down into independent functions.

tool_options.name: Docker
tool_options.reasoning: Docker allows for containerization of the application, making it easier to deploy and manage. It ensures consistency across different environments.
cons: Requires understanding of Docker.
Can add complexity to the development process.

tool_options.name: CI/CD Pipeline (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI)
tool_options.reasoning: A CI/CD pipeline automates the build, test, and deployment processes, improving efficiency and reducing errors.
key_libraries: Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar CI/CD tools
cons: Requires setup and configuration.
Can be complex to manage.

tool_options.name: Monitoring and Logging (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack)
tool_options.reasoning: Monitoring and logging tools are essential for tracking application performance, identifying issues, and debugging.
key_libraries: Prometheus, Grafana, Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana (ELK stack)
cons: Requires setup and configuration.
Can be complex to manage.

risks.description: The backend API, which is assumed to be available, may fail to process the uploaded file or retrieve recordings from the LTF AWS server.
risks.mitigation: Implement robust error handling, logging, and monitoring for the backend API. Include retry mechanisms and circuit breakers to handle temporary failures. Ensure the API has proper authentication and authorization.

risks.description: The portal may encounter issues accessing the LTF AWS server where the recordings are stored. This could be due to network problems, incorrect credentials, or server downtime.
risks.mitigation: Implement proper authentication and authorization to access the AWS server. Implement error handling and retry mechanisms. Monitor the connection to the AWS server and alert administrators of any issues. Ensure the application uses the correct AWS region and credentials.

risks.description: The portal may be vulnerable to security threats, such as SQL injection, cross-site scripting (XSS), and unauthorized access.
risks.mitigation: Implement robust security measures, including input validation, output encoding, and secure authentication and authorization. Use HTTPS for all communication. Regularly scan the application for vulnerabilities and apply security patches. Implement rate limiting to prevent brute-force attacks.

risks.description: The portal may experience performance issues, especially when handling large files or a large number of recordings.
risks.mitigation: Optimize database queries and use pagination to display results efficiently. Implement caching to reduce the load on the backend. Use asynchronous processing for file uploads and downloads. Monitor application performance and identify bottlenecks.

risks.description: The portal needs to comply with data privacy regulations and ensure the security of the V-KYC recordings.
risks.mitigation: Implement encryption for data at rest and in transit. Restrict access to recordings based on user roles and permissions. Implement audit trails to track access to recordings. Comply with relevant data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).

backend.reasoning: Node.js with Express provides a lightweight, scalable, and efficient backend solution. JavaScript allows for full-stack development with a single language. Express simplifies API creation and routing.

frontend.reasoning: React is chosen for its component-based architecture, large community, and efficient update mechanisms. It's well-suited for building interactive UIs and offers good performance.

database.reasoning: PostgreSQL is a robust, open-source relational database with excellent support for data integrity, scalability, and complex queries. It's a good choice for this project due to its reliability and ability to handle structured data.

deployment_environment.reasoning: AWS provides a comprehensive suite of services for building and deploying applications. It offers scalability, reliability, and a wide range of options for compute, storage, and databases. The existing infrastructure on LTF AWS server makes it a natural fit.

key_libraries_tools.purpose: For automating the build, test, and deployment processes.

key_libraries_tools.name: Monitoring and Logging (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack)

architecture.justification: Microservices architecture allows for independent scaling of different components, improving scalability. It also enhances maintainability by isolating concerns. This is a good fit for future growth and independent scaling of the portal's components.
key_benefits: Technology diversity (if needed in the future).
Faster development cycles for individual services.
potential_drawbacks: Increased complexity in initial setup and deployment.
Distributed tracing and monitoring are essential.

components.name: Frontend - V-KYC Portal
components.description: The user interface for uploading files, viewing results, and downloading recordings.
responsibilities: Displaying search results in a tabular format with pagination.
Making API calls to the backend.

components.name: Backend - API Gateway
components.description: The entry point for all API requests, responsible for routing, authentication, and authorization.
responsibilities: Routing API requests to the appropriate microservices.

components.name: File Processing Service
components.description: Processes uploaded CSV/TXT files containing LAN IDs.
responsibilities: Validating the uploaded file format and content.
Parsing the file and extracting LAN IDs.
Calling the Recording Service to retrieve recording details.
Returning the results to the API Gateway.

components.name: Recording Service
components.description: Retrieves recording details from the LTF AWS server.
responsibilities: Connecting to the LTF AWS server.
Retrieving recording metadata based on LAN IDs and date/month.
Storing recording metadata in the database (e.g., file name, size, download URL).
Providing API endpoints for retrieving recording details.

components.name: Database - PostgreSQL
components.description: Stores user information, recording metadata, and other relevant data.
responsibilities: Storing recording metadata (file name, size, download URL, LAN ID, date, month).
Providing efficient data retrieval and querying.

components.name: Deployment & Infrastructure
components.description: The infrastructure and processes for deploying and managing the application.
technologies: Monitoring and Logging (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack)
responsibilities: Deploying and managing the application on AWS.
Automating the build, test, and deployment processes using a CI/CD pipeline.

tables.name: recordings
tables.purpose: Stores metadata about the V-KYC recordings.

fields.name: lan_id
fields.description: The LAN ID associated with the recording.

fields.name: file_name
fields.description: The name of the recording file on the AWS server.

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: The size of the recording file in bytes.

fields.name: download_url
fields.description: The URL to download the recording from the AWS server.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: Timestamp of when the recording metadata was added.

relationships.description: A user can upload multiple files, each potentially containing multiple recordings.

data_model.justification: Relational database provides a structured and reliable way to store and manage user data and recording metadata. PostgreSQL is chosen for its robustness and support for complex queries.

endpoints.purpose: Authenticates a user and returns a JWT.
Uploads a CSV/TXT file containing LAN IDs and triggers processing.

response.description: Job ID for tracking the file processing.

endpoints.purpose: Retrieves recording details based on search criteria.
Downloads recordings based on provided criteria.

parameters.description: List of LAN IDs to download recordings for (max 10).

api_endpoints.error_handling: Centralized error handling with consistent error responses including error codes, messages, and details.
api_endpoints.rate_limiting_strategy: Token Bucket algorithm applied to all authenticated endpoints.

data_encryption.at_rest: AES-256 encryption for sensitive data in the database.

security_measures.implementation: Implement JWT authentication with secure token storage (e.g., HTTP-only cookies).
Implement RBAC to restrict access to resources based on user roles (Team Lead, Process Manager).
security_measures.mitigation: Unauthorized access to sensitive data and functionality.

security_measures.implementation: Validate all user inputs (file uploads, search parameters) to prevent injection attacks.
security_measures.mitigation: SQL injection, XSS, and other injection attacks.

security_measures.implementation: Encode all output data to prevent XSS attacks.
Encrypt sensitive data at rest (e.g., passwords, recording metadata) and in transit (HTTPS).
security_measures.mitigation: Data breaches and unauthorized access to sensitive information.

security_measures.implementation: Implement rate limiting on API endpoints to prevent brute-force attacks and abuse.
security_measures.mitigation: DoS attacks and abuse of the API.

security_measures.implementation: Implement comprehensive logging and monitoring to detect and respond to security incidents.
Regularly scan the application for vulnerabilities and apply security patches.

vulnerability_mitigation_strategies: Regular security audits and penetration testing.

scalability_and_performance.database_optimization: Use indexing on frequently queried columns (e.g., lan_id, recording_date).
scalability_and_performance.caching: Implement caching for frequently accessed data (e.g., recording metadata).
scalability_and_performance.asynchronous_processing: Use message queues (e.g., RabbitMQ, Kafka) for asynchronous file processing and downloads.
scalability_and_performance.load_balancing: Use load balancing to distribute traffic across multiple instances of the backend API.
scalability_and_performance.horizontal_scaling: Design the system to be horizontally scalable to handle increased load.
scalability_and_performance.cdn: Consider using a CDN for serving static assets (e.g., frontend files).

deployment_strategy.infrastructure_as_code: Use tools like Terraform or AWS CloudFormation to define and manage the infrastructure.
deployment_strategy.containerization: Use Docker to containerize the application and deploy it to AWS ECS or EKS.
deployment_strategy.ci_cd_pipeline: Implement a CI/CD pipeline to automate the build, test, and deployment processes.
deployment_strategy.monitoring_and_alerting: Implement monitoring and alerting using AWS CloudWatch or a similar service.
deployment_strategy.blue_green_deployment: Consider using blue/green deployment strategy for zero-downtime deployments.

monitoring_and_logging.logging_strategy: Centralized logging using a logging aggregation service (e.g., ELK stack, Splunk).
monitoring_and_logging.metrics: Collect metrics on application performance, resource utilization, and error rates.
monitoring_and_logging.monitoring_tools: Use monitoring tools like Prometheus and Grafana to visualize metrics and set up alerts.
monitoring_and_logging.health_checks: Implement health checks for all services to monitor their availability.

system_design.error_handling_strategy: Centralized error handling with consistent error responses including error codes, messages, and details. Implement retry mechanisms and circuit breakers to handle temporary failures. Log all errors with relevant context.

development_phases_overview.name: Phase 1: Requirements Gathering and Design
development_phases_overview.description: Finalize requirements, design the system architecture, and create the data model.
tasks: Refine the BRD and gather detailed requirements.
Design the system architecture and component interactions.
Define API endpoints and data formats.

development_phases_overview.name: Phase 2: Frontend Development
development_phases_overview.description: Develop the user interface for the V-KYC portal.

development_phases_overview.name: Phase 3: Backend Development and API Integration
development_phases_overview.description: Develop the backend API and integrate it with the frontend and AWS services.
tasks: Develop the Node.js backend with Express.
Implement user authentication and authorization using JWT.
Implement the recording service to interact with AWS S3.

development_phases_overview.name: Phase 4: Database Setup and Integration
development_phases_overview.description: Set up the PostgreSQL database and integrate it with the backend.
dependencies: Phase 3: Backend Development and API Integration
tasks: Implement database interactions in the backend.

development_phases_overview.name: Phase 5: Deployment and Testing
development_phases_overview.description: Deploy the application to AWS and perform thorough testing.
dependencies: Phase 3: Backend Development and API Integration
tasks: Set up the AWS infrastructure (EC2 instances, database, etc.).
Address any issues identified during testing.

development_phases_overview.name: Phase 6: Monitoring and Maintenance
development_phases_overview.description: Monitor the application, address any issues, and provide ongoing maintenance.

key_risks: Backend API Failure: The backend API, which is assumed to be available, may fail to process the uploaded file or retrieve recordings from the LTF AWS server.

LTF AWS Server Access Issues: The portal may encounter issues accessing the LTF AWS server where the recordings are stored. This could be due to network problems, incorrect credentials, or server downtime.
Security Vulnerabilities: The portal may be vulnerable to security threats, such as SQL injection, cross-site scripting (XSS), and unauthorized access.
Performance Issues: The portal may experience performance issues, especially when handling large files or a large number of recordings.
Data Privacy Concerns: The portal needs to comply with data privacy regulations and ensure the security of the V-KYC recordings.
system_design.design_justification: The chosen design leverages a microservices architecture for scalability and maintainability. React is selected for the frontend due to its component-based architecture and large community support. Node.js with Express is chosen for the backend for its efficiency and ease of development. PostgreSQL is used for the database due to its robustness and support for complex queries. AWS is selected for deployment due to its comprehensive services and existing infrastructure. This design addresses the project goals by providing easy access to recordings, reducing dependency on the IT team, and improving efficiency. Security is a primary concern, and robust measures are implemented to protect sensitive data and prevent unauthorized access.
system_design.data_flow: 1. User uploads a CSV/TXT file containing LAN IDs via the React frontend. 2. The frontend sends the file to the API Gateway. 3. The API Gateway authenticates and authorizes the user. 4. The API Gateway routes the request to the File Processing Service. 5. The File Processing Service validates and parses the file, extracting LAN IDs. 6. The File Processing Service calls the Recording Service, passing the LAN IDs. 7. The Recording Service retrieves recording metadata from the LTF AWS server. 8. The Recording Service stores recording metadata in the PostgreSQL database. 9. The Recording Service returns the recording details to the File Processing Service. 10. The File Processing Service returns the results to the API Gateway. 11. The API Gateway returns the results to the React frontend for display. 12. User can then download recordings via the frontend, which triggers a download request to the API Gateway. 13. The API Gateway calls the Recording Service to retrieve the recordings from AWS S3 and zips them. 14. The API Gateway streams the zip file to the user.

Original summary: Develop a web portal for V-KYC team leads and process managers to access and download V-KYC recordings for audit and other requirements. The portal will allow users to upload a CSV/TXT file containing LAN IDs, display results in a tabular format with pagination and search, and provide download functionality. The backend will be built using Node.js and Express, with a PostgreSQL database. The frontend will be built using React. The application will be deployed on AWS using a microservices architecture and a CI/CD pipeline.'}) summary='Develop a web portal for V-KYC team leads and process managers to access and download V-KYC recordings for audit and other requirements. The portal will allow users to upload a CSV/TXT file containing LAN IDs, display results in a tabular format with pagination and search, and provide download functionality. The backend will be built using Node.js and Express, with a PostgreSQL database. The frontend will be built using React. The application will be deployed on AWS using a microservices architecture and a CI/CD pipeline.' metadata=PlanMetadata(generated_at='2025-07-08T12:47:19.391056', version='1.0', author='Multi-AI Dev System', tags=[], notes='Converted from WorkItemBacklog. Original summary: Develop a web portal for V-KYC team leads and process managers to access and download V-KYC recordings for audit and other requirements. The portal will allow users to upload a CSV/TXT file containing LAN IDs, display results in a tabular format with pagination and search, and provide download functionality. The backend will be built using Node.js and Express, with a PostgreSQL database. The frontend will be built using React. The application will be deployed on AWS using a microservices architecture and a CI/CD pipeline.')
